text: I don't think it is possible to change the /tags setting unless you are going to create a new page with a different URL path and redirect the /tags path (not advised)

Hey! Anyone know if the "spacing" field, when used as a style field in a custom module, can have separate desktop and mobile parameters setup as default in a theme template? The option appears to be there, but they are not saved as separate attributes.
gotta create a mobile and desktop group :cry:
Howdy! So, is there a way to backup/export a website that also downloads all images, js, css etc? The HubSpot export pages feature is essentially only a wget command and only exports html

Yeah, can do separate fields, but then you still have the little icons above where you can filter between desktop/mobile settings. Having those there, with no working functionality in a custom module, makes the module look like it's broken. I know this is more than spacing field issue, but you'd expect it to work on that field type if it worked on any. :confused:

Hello. I'm having an issue where a page looks fine when editing it, and in preview.  But, after saving it, the fonts and style settings look different on the live page. Does anyone know what might cause this? Or where I can start look to troubleshoot it?
have you checked the dev console in chrome developer tools to see if there are any errors? Right click + inspect
If you want you can share the url, and i would look at it later.
I just fixed it. Turns out all I needed was to re-publish the theme settings :face_palm:

Knowledgebase down for anybody else?

All we see is this message: `Request rejected, because isolation group default executor is full.`
